entry.title: Only consider a V4 error retriable if the HTTP response is unset or OK
entry.content:
This CL ensures that backoff is incremented if the HTTP response is an

error, and it avoids incrementing it if the response is OK.



This does not change much in practice because it is very rare for the

HTTP response to be anything other than unset when the relevant

retriable net errors are hit (ERR_INTERNET_DISCONNECTED and

ERR_NETWORK_CHANGED).

entry.title: Replace base::GUID uses with base::Uuid (171/N)
entry.content:
`base::GUID` has been renamed, and is set to be removed. This CL is

part of a batch of changes replacing all uses of `base::GUID`, with

`base::Uuid`, and its associated counterparts.



Additionally, deprecated functions in `base/uuid.h` are also having

their uses removed wherever they occur.



Changes for path: /chrome/browser/sync



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.

entry.title: Revert "[Read Anything] Test the Read Anything WebUI in a browsertest."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 8f3988a8e799e821754db7ad4fa1d4c6f103ae47.



Reason for revert: Suspected to cause/expose MSAN failures, compare https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20ChromiumOS%20MSan%20Tests/35370/overview and crbug.com/1439680



Original change's description:

> [Read Anything] Test the Read Anything WebUI in a browsertest.

>

> The webui test architecture was not designed to handle untrusted

> tests. This CL replaces the webui test read_anything_app_test.ts with

> a new browsertest, read_anything_app_browsertest.cc. It uses EvalJs

> to inject the scripts written in read_anything_app_test.ts. The

> trade-off is that this won’t check for untrusted sources being added.

>

> Alternatives explored:

> 1. Migrate test to chrome-untrusted://. This would require upgrading

> the infrastructure which was explored in

> https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4292217/

> but which would need further design to land.

> 2. Test in chrome:// with iframe of the chrome-untrusted:// UI. This

> requires handling communication across the iframe. Future debugging

> might be tricky.

> 3. Serve webui as trusted just in test build. This means a diverging

> implementation and test.

>

> Bug: 1266555

> Change-Id: Ibe996fd85303310088b1cb52cd939c9c27664528

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4343530

> Code-Coverage: Findit

> Commit-Queue: Abigail Klein

> Reviewed-by: David Tseng

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1134787}

entry.title: Remove flame-chart.js layout test
entry.content:
As part of the attached bug, we are changing the API for the data

structure that the flame chart expects. As part of the work we have done

on test coverage, the FlameChart component is now extensively tested via

both unit and screenshot tests in the devtools-frontend repository, so

we do not need to keep this test around, especially as it is a smoke

test and just checks generally that the component "works". We know that

if this component breaks, many tests in devtools-frontend will now fail.

entry.title: [ios] Cleanup of NavigationItem/NavigationManager
entry.content:
Use generic annotations of NSDictionary key and value used to store

the HTTP headers (they are both NSString).



Define default value for member fields of NavigationItemImpl at the

point of declaration (this reduces the risk of not settings a value

when adding more constructors in the future).



Call CloneDataFrom(...) in NavigationItemImpl to allow copying the

attached base::SupportsUserData::Data if they are cloneable.

entry.title: arc: Disable vmm swap when system state observe active
entry.content:
Previously, the swap state enable / disable both base on Polling in

a uniform distribution timer. However, in some cases, ARC need

exit swapped state ASAP after user start re-use the device.



This CL add the callback, so that the swap state will be set disabled

immediately after system state observation found the ARC activated.



BUG=b:265383671

TEST=ArcVmmSwapSchedulerTest

entry.title: Revert "media/gpu/VP8VaapiVED: Specify a loop filter level by rate controller"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 9618a2544990fc2a6f5ebe51c1d28ddd85e114c4.



Reason for revert: This causes a GPU process crash crbug.com/1435546



Original change's description:

> media/gpu/VP8VaapiVED: Specify a loop filter level by rate controller

>

> Originally, we set the highest loop filter level, 63, all the time. It

> causes inefficiency in compression; an encoder driver produces the

> large chunk even for identical frames. We need to rather specify a

> smaller loop filter level [1].

> This CL specifies a loop filter level computed by a software rate

> controller to each frame.

>

> [1] Chapter 6. https://static.googleusercontent.com/media/research.google.com/ja//pubs/archive/37073.pdf

>

> Bug: b:253135900

> Test: ./video_encode_accelerator_tests youtube_screenshot_static.yuv --codec=vp8

> Change-Id: I4327f28fca86f10f0c079d131a0aa85991e1b4a9

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4421371

> Commit-Queue: Hirokazu Honda

> Code-Coverage: Findit

> Reviewed-by: Justin Green

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1132871}

entry.title: [iOS] Use string IDs instead of raw strings in bookmark tests
entry.content:
The use of raw string for snackbar text tests make the tests fragile,

since they fail if the string content is updated, or if the tests are

executed on devices with non-English default language.



This CL replaces the raw strings by string ID to prevent failure in

those cases.

entry.title: [Extensions] Fix dangling pointer caused by OTR profile destruction
entry.content:
Since an OTR profile for a browser can be destroyed before the

browser's UserData, a ProfileObserver is added to the

ExtensionSidePanelManager to destroy its data (extension side panels

should not exist without a profile, and said OTR profile destruction

should only happen on browser destruction) and reset its profile_ ptr

to prevent a dangling pointer.

entry.title: [Lacros] Disable account consistency in guest sessions
entry.content:
In guest sessions, profiles can be regular and guest at the same time.

When this is the case, account consistency should be disabled.

This was the case for "public" guest sessions, but not other guest

sessions.



This was causing a DCHECK when running in Guest mode in the simulator

(and maybe on devices too).

entry.title: Revert "Implement contain style scope manager"
entry.content:
This reverts commit bf700377ff5911705a81a410be2fad9018aae9d1.



Reason for revert: Performance regression



Original change's description:

> Implement contain style scope manager

>

> In order to be able to handle quotes (and later counters)

> with respect to the "contain: style" subtrees, a contain style scope

> manager has been introduced.

entry.title: [BestEffortServiceWorker] Add UseCounter
entry.content:
This CL adds UseCounter when the RaceNetworkRequest is used (dispatched).

UseCounter is needed for the future OriginTrial.



For main resources, we simply call `ServiceWorkerVersion::CountFeature`.



For subresources, we add `did_start_race_network_request` to

DispatchFetchEventParams mojom, and call UseCounter in the

ServiceWorkerGlobalScope. This is because we don't have easy way to call

UseCounter from ServiceWorkerSubresourceLoader, which is in

`content/renderer`. So passing the flag to ServiceWorkerGlobalScope

looks a simple approach.



Bug: 1420517

Change-Id: Ifd747bf0d692497c908b80ad9aee92ce08362568

entry.title: Add OOP support for Windows GetPrintableArea
entry.content:
This is a follow-up to https://crrev.com/1128325 for out-of-process

print drivers.



When getting the default printer capabilities and settings, updates in

https://crrev.com/1099645 filled in the printable area for all paper

sizes supported by a Windows driver. For some printer drivers this can

be a relatively expensive call. Since this is in an inner loop of

supported papers sizes, the performance cost is further compounded when

a printer supports many different paper sizes. This can result in

large delays in generating the Print Preview.



This performance impact was resolved for in-browser printing calls in

https://crrev.com/1128325, but that update left OOPPD still with slower

performance.



To remove this performance impact, modify the Windows behavior for OOP

paper printable area handling. Change getting printer capabilities to

only retrieve the printable area for the default paper size when the

print driver interactions are run in the Print Backend service. This

makes OOP use a similar workaround as was done for in-browser printing

calls. Adjust TestPrintBackend in the same manner as PrintBackendWin,

so that it continues to provide the same underlying behavior.



Modify PrinterQuery to support getting the paper printable area from an

asynchronous call. Add a plumbing path for GetPaperPrintableArea()

into the Print Backend service.



Fixed: 1432720

Change-Id: Ib8405a45adbf26ddfaf0ee03cf6806ab72a1ef18

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4429418

entry.title: Fix permissions issue with iframes nested in fenced frames.
entry.content:
This CL fixes a bug related to permissions policies in iframes nested

within fenced frames. For policies that are not explicitly disabled in a

fenced frame, if the fenced frame's document response disallows a

permissions policy, it is still allowed in the iframe nested within the

fenced frame. It was first found with the Attribution Reporting API

policy, but this bug applies to any permissions policy that can be set

in a fenced frame.



The bug occurred because iframes nested inside of fenced frames were

always treated as fenced frames, and their permissions policies were set

with `PermissionsPolicy::CreateForFencedFrame()`, which intentionally

does not look at parent frames. While this was suitable when permissions

policies were completely disabled in fenced frames, it became

problematic when permissions started being allowed (including allowing

a document to further restrict permissions), and child frames needed to

access the embedding fenced frame's permissions policies to know which

permissions to disable.



After this fix, `PermissionsPolicy::CreateForFencedFrame()` will only

be called on a fenced frame root. Subframes nested in fenced frames

will now use the `PermissionsPolicy::CreateFromParentPolicy()` method

the same way that subframes outside of fenced frame trees currently

do.



This CL adds WPTs to check that iframes nested in fenced frames have

their permissions set as expected.



This CL also fixes an issue with client hint code that was causing an

iframe nested in a fenced frame to pull the permissions policy from the

outermost main frame rather than its fenced frame root.



Bug: 1428913

Change-Id: I590425d59a8f19e37313bd3dedf0d56b35c87f80

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4377538

Code-Coverage: Findit

Reviewed-by: Ari Chivukula

entry.title: [scoped-registry] Move construction stack to custom element constructors
entry.content:
This patch moves the construction stack from custom element definitions

to constructors. There should not be any behavioral change (with

detailed explanation in the code), and the only purpose is to support

scoped custom element registries.



To support unit tests, this patch also introduces

CustomElementTestingScope, which ensures that every

TestCustomElementDefinition also gets a mock constructor that can be

used as a hash key but not callable.

entry.title: [CrOS Cellular] Fine turning the esim install retry policy
entry.content:
Except in the case of missing internet connectivity, we were retrying

once a day for a total of three times. This change fine tunes our

approach and categorizes installation errors into three parts:



1. Internal errors

2. User errors

3. Other errors



We are now reverting back to our old policy on Internal errors, not

retrying at all on user errors and following the new policy of once a

day for other errors.

entry.title: [PDF OCR] Rebuild PDF accessibility tree with OCR results for AXAction
entry.content:
Need to keep PDF accessibility tree up-to-date with OCR results in PDF

renderer so that it can handle AXAction on nodes built from OCR results

appropriately. The ScreenAI process now returns AXTreeUpdate created

with OCR results back to PDF renderer, which is then used to rebuild

PDF accessibility tree in OnOcrDataReceived(). As bounds of nodes

in this AXTreeUpdate are local, they are being updated with `transform`

that we create from the image for OCR and `offset` of its page node.



Link to one pager: go/pdf-ocr-axaction

entry.title: Run WebGL conformance tests in an iframe
entry.content:
Updates the WebGL conformance test runner to run tests in an iframe

instead of loading the pages directly in Chrome. This has the primary

benefit of allowing us to ensure that we establish the websocket

connection necessary for the heartbeat mechanism before any test code

is run. This should reduce, or hopefully completely remove, the need

for Slow expectations, as we can now guarantee that we actually have a

mechanism to receive heartbeats during a test.



As an example of this, the

conformance/uniforms/no-over-optimization-on-uniform-array-* tests

which have given us numerous issues with the heartbeat mechanism have

entry.title: Add `snap_action_source_` variable in WindowSnapWMEvent
entry.content:
In this CL:

- Move the `snap_action_source_` from WindowState to WindowSnapWMEvent.

The `snap_action_source_` was a member variable in WindowState before,

but WindowSnapWMEvent should be a better place since we can log the

metrics more accurately when the WindowState handles the event and

the window state changes to a snapped window state.

- Add more different snap action sources so that the distribution is

more accurate.

- Note kSnapByWindowLayoutMenu and kLongPressCaptionButtonToSnap are

used to record snap usage from the window layout menu and the caption

snap buttons for ash browser window. Lacros window usage will be

handled separately in a future CL.



Bug: b/278761433

Change-Id: I04ae80753a1f3c24d6c430379fae9cb843a1d9ea

entry.title: Add PartialLowEndModeOnMidRangeDevices feature.
entry.content:
Add PartialLowEndModeOnMidRangeDevices feature for Android 4GB and

6GB devices.

Such devices aren't considered low-end, but we'd like experiment with a subset of low-end features to see if we get a good memory vs. performance tradeoff.

We will not introduce any user-visible changes which cause bad UX or

any huge performance regressions by the experiment. So not all

base::SysInfo::IsLowEndDevice() are replaced with base::SysInfo::

IsLowEndDeviceOrPartialLowEndModeEnabled().



Bug: 1434873

entry.title: Use dialog focus algorithm for dialog popovers
entry.content:
This patch makes it so that when a gets opened as a

popover, it uses the dialog initial focus algorithm instead of the

popover initial focus algorithm.



The popover initial focus algorithm only focuses descendants with the

autofocus attribute, whereas the dialog initial focus algorithm focuses

anything that's focusable.



HTML spec PR: https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/9121



Fixed: 1430405

entry.title: Misc. cleanup. No functional change.
entry.content:
* Use `base::expected` instead of `absl::optional` for

"success, or optional error". This is slightly clearer (".has_value()"

doesn't have inverted semantics) and will let us use macros/monadics

with `expected` in the future.

* `+` is briefer than `StrCat` for simple cases, and `StrCat` is more

efficient than `StringPrintf` for others.

* Use () and not {} for function-style-casts, which is more compliant

with the style guide.

* Add a few missing #includes.

* Use `expected` monadic ops.

entry.title: [Extensions] Curry and use messaging ChannelType
entry.content:
In extensions, we currently use the channel name to determine certain

properties of a message channel, such as which listener to dispatch a

message to. However, the channel name can be set by the extension,

which can result in the message going to an unexpected event.



A precursor CL introduced the ChannelType enum so we can better know

which type of channel a message channel is. This CL finishes that work

by plumbing the channel type from the renderer process opening the

channel, through to the browser process, then back to receiving

renderers. This fixes the issue of potentially treating the channel

incorrectly.



In particular:

- Add ChannelType to the parameters sent to the browser via IPC when

opening a new channel.

- Curry this through the browser side, adding it to the message ports

- Send this back through to the renderer in the DispatchOnConnect and

OpenChannel messages.

* In the interest of shaving more yaks, this also required adding a

new struct, ExtensionMsg_OnConnectData, since IPC messages don't

support sending 6 arguments.

- In the renderer, check the ChannelType (rather than channel name)

to determine the events to use.



With this, setting a channel name should no longer influence the

event receiving a message.



Bug: 1430999

Change-Id: Ie3c32f1d8d56b3e23e9ec83dafc472a6a51c0219

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4437093

Reviewed-by: Tim

Reviewed-by: Matthew Denton

Commit-Queue: Devlin Cronin

entry.title: media/gpu: Support keyframeless VP9 resolution changes for testing
entry.content:
VP9 verification sets "frm_resize" and "sub8x8_sf" [1] change

resolutions mid-stream without Key-frames. This is an arcane

feature and rare in the wild, where the rule is to have keyframes

to signal new resolutions.



ToT VP9Decoder considers any resolution changes a kConfigChange,

which causes the client to drop reference frames and reallocate

surfaces and context(s). But VA-API VideoDecoders on Intel and

AMD do support reusing the current context and surfaces for

smaller resolutions; https://crrev.com/c/4032552 did just that,

hence verifying the test vectors, but breaking DRM overlays ([2]),

so it was reverted.



In the large scheme of things, though, we'd rather reallocate the

context and surfaces when the resolution decreases (to have a

smaller mem footprint, not to mention to keep DRM overlays working),

rather than reusing things just to satisfy a theoretical concern.



So after a few tries at fixing this in code ([3,4] - ugly stuff),

I decided to give up and take up the suggestion in [5] to make

this a test only feature. With that, this CL adds a test flag and

sets it from v_d_a_tests code.



[1] https://www.webmproject.org/vp9/levels/#test-descriptions

[2] I dug into this for a while and I believe this was due to

VAAPI reusing |coded_size| and reducing the visible area while

the DRM API really needed both to be accurate. Maybe I'll dig

some more and try to find a repro case to file a bug.

Also note that FFmpeg+VA_API does support this non-reallocation

mode but would have the same DRM overlays issue if it was to

support them.

[3] https://crrev.com/c/4409593

[4] https://crrev.com/c/4437095

[5] https://crrev.com/c/4409593/2/media/gpu/vaapi/vaapi_video_decoder.cc#1145



Bug: b:207057398



Change-Id: Idb920f9e8e12704148cacc68befd5c5fb480e0ca

entry.title: Fix erroneous SupportsOstreamOperator<int> instantiation.
entry.content:
Detecting whether `ostream << T` is well-formed requires having any

relevant declarations of operator<<() in-scope. For basic types, these

are declared in , so the file defining SupportsOstreamOperator

should #include that to guarantee all callers see the same results.



Erroneous instantiations are especially insidious because they easily

lead to ODR violations and cryptic behavior changes in

seemingly-unrelated TUs.



To minimize compile-time increases, this also splits ToString() and

SupportsOstreamOperator into their own headers.



Bug: none

Change-Id: I7ea9b53aa7b453bc94f61dcf1688ecb4e4d15003

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4448868

entry.title: [Extensions] Adds a CHECK that site access is updated only when allowed
entry.content:
We should not update user site access when the user is not allowed

to select such access. Thus, this CL adds CHECK to SitePermissionsHelper::UpdateSiteAccess to make sure we never call this

with a not allowed update.



Since we need to make sure callers don't call with invalid options,

now extensions context menu only updates site access if the web

contents origins are the same (context menu model can stay open

with a page navigation).



Bug: 1433363

entry.title: Reland [clang] Disable autoupgrading debug info in ThinLTO builds
entry.content:
ThinLTO reads bitcode many times and attempts to upgrade the debug info every time. This is expensive since it calls the verifier. We don't need this given all LLVM bitcode producers are from the same version of LLVM.



For just the build step that runs ThinLTO and links official Chrome, measured 34T -> 32T instructions via perf stat.



Reland disables adding flag for ChromeOS since that toolchain is too old to have this flag.



Bug: 972449

Change-Id: I44552dd6c9dc71683c002d0c885e78b2a4341659

existing flag is now repurposed for controlling the Finch

entry.title: Settings: Move CrOS OWNERS to chromeos/OWNERS
entry.content:
Entries in c/b/r/settings/OWNERS included CrOS-only reviewers which has

entry.title: Include client-drawn window decorations in aspect ratio.
entry.content:
Widget::SetAspectRatio() should set the aspect ratio of the content

area only, excluding the title bar and other decorations. To do so,

it assumes that the underlying platform window system ignores its

own title bar and other decorations when enforcing the aspect ratio.



Unfortunately, this doesn't work in those cases where chrome draws

the decorations in the non-client area; the underlying window manager

has no idea that these should be excluded, and the aspect ratio

of the Widget's contents is now wrong. This is visible in Picture

in Picture windows, which have a (chrome-drawn) title bar, and which

support aspect ratio lock.



This CL allows a WidgetDelegate to specify an additional number of

screen pixels to exclude from the aspect ratio calculation to take

into account any chrome-drawn decorations.



This CL includes the plumbing for the excluded margin, and an

implementation for Windows. Other implementations will follow in

separate CLs.



Change-Id: I150a8c806d42a9a60b6710fe300671b6afe9ac8c

entry.title: Adjust the shard numbers for Android 12, 12L, and 13 builders.
entry.content:
In details:

* android_browsertests: 2 -> 4

* content_browsertests: 25 -> 40



It appears the StartInstrumentation in these gtest suites has a timeout

threshold at ~19mins. And emulators hit this threshold quite often with

the original shard number and then could not recover from it, thus leave

a lot of tests in NORUN state.



Bump the shard so that runtime of each shard would be around 15mins and

reduce the chance to hit the timeout threshold.



Hopefully this would reduce the infra flakiness.

entry.title: Use GetFrameHostForNavigation() when picking error page RFH
entry.content:
When picking an RFH when committing an error page, in some cases it's

required to commit in the same process, e.g. for renderer-initiated

navigations that got blocked. Currently, the code immediately choose

to commit in the current RFH, which won't work with RenderDocument,

where cross-document navigations should change RenderFrameHosts.



This CL fixes the problem by making all cases of RFH picking for

error page navigations to call GetFrameHostForNavigation(), which

will work with RenderDocument, and updates that function to handle

the requirement for some error page navigations to commit in the

current process.



Bug: 936696

entry.title: Side aligned toasts and toast/popup/secondary bubble Fixes
entry.content:
The changes related to the toast position are guarded under a flag.

To test this change, run with `--enable-features=SideAlignedToasts`.



Move toasts default location to the side, at the same place where

notification popups usually show up. Toasts now have a higher z-index by

being placed in the `DragImageAndTooltipContainer`, so they will show in

front of tray bubbles and notification popups.



ToastOverlay now observes UnifiedSystemTray, so side aligned toasts

baseline will be shifted up whenever a slider bubble is shown.



Also updated (these are general fixes, not under the flag):

- Fixed a toast leading icon padding issue in RTL

- Fixed notification popup position in RTL with right shelf

- Remove `show_on_lock_screen` parameter in ToastOverlay since

ToastManager already handles the lock screen case. (toasts are queued

whenever the session is locked and `show_on_lock_screen` is false)

- Fix spacing between secondary bubbles (e.g. Sliders) and popups

- Rename `SetTrayBubbleHeight` to `NotifySecondaryBubbleHeight` in

unified_system_tray and in ash_message_popup_collection to

`SetBaselineOffset`



screenshots: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/3tPAwHGhTeKSmr2



go/side-aligned-toasts

entry.title: Allow web attribution to be independently configurable in OS-Support
entry.content:
https://github.com/WICG/attribution-reporting-api/pull/758



Web attribution is explicitly disabled for WebView. This CL extends

the OS support enum to allow web attribution to be independently

configurable, and the Attribution-Reporting-Support header will

indicate the support level accordingly.



If neither web nor os-level attribution is enabled, background

attributionsrc requests will not be made, and

the Attribuiton-Reporting-Eligible header will not be set on requests.

Note that this applies even when kAttributionReportingCrossAppWeb

feature is disabled to avoid bandwidth waste.



A virtual function is added to ContentBrowserClient to allow WebView

to disable web attribution. A follow-up CL will enable OS support and

disable web support on WebView.



Note that we cannot add web tests for the NoWebOrOsSupport DevTools

issue type as there is no way to override the OS support value there.



Side note: when both web and OS are supported, the header is updated

to "os, web" to align with the explainer.

entry.title: [HTTPS-Upgrades] Skip upgrades for non-unique hostnames
entry.content:
Previously, HTTPS upgrading skipped over requests for local IPs, since

it's not possible to get a publicly-trusted cert for them.



This CL expands that logic to all non-unique hostnames, since the same

logic applies.



Technically, it's possible for HTTPS to work on any of these hosts if

you have a locally-installed root cert, but the odds of success are low

and this keeps metrics more consistent across non-unique hosts. Note,

however, that recording the non-unique host enum still means something

different depending on whether HFM is enabled or not.

entry.title: Add GetPaperPrintableArea to PrintBackendServiceManager
entry.content:
If the print backend process terminates then it is necessary to have

extra handling to ensure that callbacks are still made, as otherwise

the UI can end up in a stuck state.



Extend PrintBackendServiceManager to include a wrapper around the

GetPaperPrintableArea() call, to include protection against this

scenario.



Modified the templates slightly to accommodate compiling with a

parameter type of `const gfx::Rect>&`.

entry.title: Revert "[a11y] SetSize/PosInSet computed incorrectly for nested `TreeItems`"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 199d044ccb1a01f267f38e30ac357e3bf890e21a.



Reason for revert: Speculative revert for ReadAnythingAppTest failures

crbug.com/1439680

Example: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20MSan%20Tests/39804/overview



Original change's description:

> [a11y] SetSize/PosInSet computed incorrectly for nested `TreeItems`

>

> This CL fixes a bug where the `SetSize` and `PosInSet` attributes are

> computed incorrectly for nodes with role `kTreeItem` that are nested

> within other `kTreeItem` nodes.

>

> We do this by internally now consider a node with role `kTreeItem` that

> is in a ordered set with role `kTreeItem` as matching, which we used to

> not do before.

>

> Previously, for a node with role `kTreeItem` to be considered

> to be matching it's ordered set's role, the set's role

> had to be `kTree`.

>

> Since `kTreeItem` nodes could have nested `kTreeItem` nodes,

> this behavior was incorrect.

>

> This CL also adds a test for when a `kTreeItem`'s parent is a

> `kGroup` element, which we were not testing for before.

>

> https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Accessibility/ARIA/Roles/treeitem_role

>

> Change-Id: I65a82cd0a9da4288870ca2f983436e98c45db463

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4450328

> Commit-Queue: Javier Contreras

> Commit-Queue: Benjamin Beaudry

> Reviewed-by: Benjamin Beaudry

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1134773}
